chase.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: to quickly follow someone or something in order to catch them
chase.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: The dogs saw him running and chased him.
The police chased the suspect along Severn Avenue.
A gang of boys chased after her, calling her names.
chase.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: to make someone or something leave, especially by following them for a short distance and threatening them
chase.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: The men were chased off by troops, who fired warning shots.
Anne went to chase the dog out of the garden.
chase.translation[0].definitions[2].defi: to use a lot of time and effort trying to get something such as work or money
chase.translation[0].definitions[2].exam: Top graduates from the university are chased by major companies.
chase.translation[0].definitions[3].exam: I was chasing around getting everything organized.
chase.translation[0].definitions[4].defi: to try hard to make someone notice you and pay attention to you, because you want to have a romantic relationship with them
chase.translation[0].definitions[4].exam: ‘Sometimes a girl wants to be chased, ’ Amelia said.
chase.translation[0].definitions[5].defi: to decorate metal with a special tool
